poem:
### Olivia's Virtual Playground

In the suburbs of slow connections,  
a lonely child waits,  
her screen a window  
to the hilarious world beyond.  
Cats leap and tumble—furred comedians  
on a pixelated stage—  
costly as they are,  
they bring laughter,  
a dial-up delight  
streaming through  
the digital night.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Olivia De Zilva: the 10 funniest things I have ever seen (on the internet) As a perpetually lonely child in the planned suburbs of Adelaide, I grew up on the internet. The first memory I have of accessing YouTube was waiting three days for my dial-up internet to load Vanessa Hudgen’s music video for Come Back to Me. It cost my parents a lot of money, but I couldn’t resist the pull of funny cat". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
